jobs.title: GTM, Strategy & Delivery
jobs.description:
GTM, Strategy & Delivery

Location: Greater London

About Ankar
The way companies innovate is broken. The systems built to create and protect ideas can’t keep up with the pace of change. Today, 90% of S&P 500 company value is intangible (e.g., in intellectual property) - yet R&D and IP teams spend half their time buried in manual work. We’re here to fix that. Ankar is building the AI operating system for innovation, reinventing how companies generate and protect their inventions. Our platform orchestrates how ideas become defensible IP with a suite of AI modules such as patent drafting, office action response, and infringement detection.

We’re at an inflection point:
- We’ve raised >24M to date from Tier-1 VCs like Atomico, Index Ventures, Norrsken, Daphni, and angels like the Founder of Hugging Face, CEO from Datadog, and Leaders from Deep Mind and OpenAI.
- We’re already working with the world’s most innovative companies including Fortune 500 company L’Oréal and global law firm Vorys.
- Expanding our world-class team with alumni from Palantir, Amazon, and BCG to tackle the 1T+ innovation market.

What you’ll be doing
We’re looking for a hands‑on generalist who can bridge product, engineering, and go‑to‑market — embedding with customers and internal teams to design, prototype, and deploy proofs of concept and new products.
- Lead end‑to‑end delivery of customer POCs and new product rollouts.
- Partner with customers to design and deliver high‑value POCs and new products.
- Work closely with customer teams to ensure successful adoption and value delivery.
- Turn customer feedback into clear product requirements.
- Spot emerging product opportunities across deployments.

What we are looking for
- 2+ years of experience in a high‑ownership environment (e.g., startups, consulting, banking, or similar fast‑moving roles).
- A builder’s mindset. You thrive in ambiguity, iterate quickly, and love creating order out of chaos.
- Extreme ownership. You see problems before they happen, you take responsibility, and you deliver.
- [Bonus points] Experience designing and delivering proof of concepts and new products to enterprise customers.

What else you might want to know
- Location: Hoxton Square, London (office-first policy with flexibility)
- Contract: Full‑time
- Compensation: Competitive salaries + substantial equity package under the tax‑efficient EMI scheme.
- Hiring process: (1) 30min introductory chat, (2) 2hr onsite interview, (3) 20min final in-person meeting.
- Visa sponsorship: Yes

jobs.title: Engineer (Digital Library)
jobs.description:
Engineer (Digital Library)

The interviews will be held on the Wednesday 4th March 2026

This role will be based on the university campus with scope for it to be undertaken in a hybrid manner. We are also open to discussing flexible working arrangements.

Are you interested in using your development and support knowledge and skills in a diverse Product Engineering function for Digital Library services? Are you an enthusiastic and driven individual with a desire to be part of a team delivering high-quality IT services to support digital access to the Libraries’ Cultural Collections?

The University of Leeds is one of the top 135 universities in the world. We have a truly global community, with more than 39,000 students from 170 different countries and over 9,000 staff of 100 different nationalities.

The University’s Cultural Collections comprise hundreds of thousands of rare books, manuscripts, archives, art works and museum artefacts. Our collections offer a rich resource for researchers, students and the wider research community.

As an Engineer with Python development skills, you will be working as part of a team to deliver the technical infrastructure and services of the Digital Library Infrastructure Project (DLIP), during and beyond the life of the project. DLIP is a cornerstone project to support the University in meeting the objectives set out in the Digital Transformation component of the Universal Values, Global Changes, University of Leeds Strategy 2020 to 2030. It implements the Digital Futures strand of the Libraries Vision.

The Digital Library Infrastructure Project will deliver a sustainable digital libraries research and education infrastructure, respond to the rapidly changing expectations of our students, staff, and partners and support the aims of University’s strategy.

You will be working as part of the DLIP team to implement:
An updated cultural collections website to improve user experience, access, and opportunities for digital creativity and cultures, featuring digital content presented in the IIIF standard;
A modern data platform to merge data from different sources into a linked data format (Linked Art) to make it more effective, in combination with a graph-based search engine, for search, research, and teaching;
Improvements to the process for storing and managing digital surrogates and digital born content to reduce risk and increase access;
A foundational cloud infrastructure for digital humanities research and teaching.

You will utilise your skills, knowledge and experience to support the DLIP project, working as part of the team to design, develop and implement solutions. You will have experience of development using Python, and database development through SQL. You will also use your experience of analysing and diagnosing issues in applications to support the project.

Working in a complex environment, you will be liaising closely with colleagues with both technical and domain subject matter expertise, and working with a diverse range of stakeholders, and providing high quality support for applications and maintaining thorough documentation.

DLIP is implementing innovative approaches and, in order to apply appropriate technical solutions, you will develop a digital library domain knowledge and an evolving understanding of the landscape, including the field of digital asset management and digital scholarship, use of data schemas and of interoperable standards such as IIIF (the International Image Interoperability Framework)

Please note that due to Home Office visa requirements, this role may only be suitable for first-time Skilled Worker visa applicants if they are eligible for salary concessions. For more information please visit: www.gov.uk/skilled-worker-visa For research and academic posts, we will consider eligibility under the Global Talent visa. For more information please visit: https://www.gov.uk/global-talent.

What We Offer In Return:
- 26 days holiday plus approx.16 Bank Holidays/days that the University is closed by custom (including Christmas) – That’s 42 days a year!
- Generous pension scheme plus life assurance– the University contributes 14.5%
- Health and Wellbeing: Discounted staff membership options at The Edge, our state-of-the-art Campus gym, with a pool, sauna, climbing wall, cycle circuit, and sports halls.
- Personal Development: Access to courses run by our Organisational Development & Professional Learning team.
- Access to on-site childcare, shopping discounts and travel schemes are also available.

To explore the post further or for any queries you may have, please contact:
Anna Cale, Operations Manager
Email: a.p.cale@leeds.ac.uk

jobs.title: Teach English Abroad - Full-Time (Visa & Health)
jobs.description:
Teach English Abroad - Full-Time (Visa & Health)

A language education organization is recruiting entry-level English teachers to teach young learners aged 3–16 in China. This full-time role emphasizes engaging methodologies alongside comprehensive training for candidates who hold a bachelor's degree and are genuinely interested in education.

The position offers benefits such as a competitive salary, performance bonuses, health insurance, and visa sponsorship, making it an excellent starting point for recent graduates or professionals looking to begin their teaching careers abroad.

Key Details:
- Role: English Teacher (Young Learners)
- Location: Recruiting from Luton (Deployment to China)
- Bachelor's degree required
- Comprehensive training provided
- Visa sponsorship and health insurance included

jobs.title: Pelvic Urology Oncology Robotic Fellow
jobs.description:
Pelvic Urology Oncology Robotic Fellow (StR Higher)

Job Summary:
The Urology Department, led by Mr. Paul Hunter-Campbell, consists of 14 consultants and a team of nine middle‑grade doctors, trainees, foundation doctors, surgical care practitioners, and specialist nurses providing 24‑hour on‑call cover. Our outpatient department at the Chestnut Unit offers one‑stop clinics and the state‑of‑the‑art Da Vinci X robotic system in the Freedom Operating Theatres for robotic surgeries.

Services Provided:
- Complex kidney stone surgery
- Functional and neuro‑urology
- Andrological care for the entire Peninsula
- Bladder outflow obstruction treatments including HoLEP
- Paediatric urology, including laparoscopic procedures
- Kidney transplantation
- Uro‑oncology services for prostate, bladder, renal, and penile cancers
- Tertiary referrals for radical procedures

Main Duties:
The fellowship provides in‑depth experience in robotic pelvic oncology surgery, particularly radical prostatectomy and cystectomy, with the goal of enabling independent robotic surgery practice. Overseas applicants must be eligible for GMC registration and have an overall IELTS score of at least 7.5.

Responsibilities:
- Comprehensive robotic training focused on pelvic malignancies
- Managing urological oncology patients
- Collaborating with multidisciplinary teams
- Contributing to clinical research and audit projects
- Participating in teaching and training

Qualifications:
- Completed FRCS Urol
- On the UK Specialist Register or eligible within six months

Pay Scheme: Hospital medical and dental staff
Salary: £73,992 per annum
Contract: Fixed term (12 months)

jobs.title: IB DP Teacher (Multi-Subject)
jobs.description:
IB DP Teacher (Multi-Subject) – Permanent, Visa Sponsorship

An educational institution in Greater London is seeking passionate teachers for the International Baccalaureate Diploma Programme (IB DP).

jobs.title: Senior Monitoring Manager – Compliance Monitoring
jobs.description:
Senior Monitoring Manager – Compliance Monitoring (Second Line) | S4 | Risk & Compliance

Join our community: Ready to take the next step in your risk and compliance career and lead where it counts? We’re offering an exciting opportunity to step into a high-impact, future‑focussed leadership role at the heart of our second line Monitoring & Testing team.

The difference you’ll make:
- Managing the delivery of multiple compliance monitoring reviews across diverse regulated activities.
- Managing and developing colleagues to build technical capability and foster a learning culture.
- Supporting a forward‑looking, data‑led monitoring plan aligned to regulatory and internal risk priorities.
- Providing subject matter input on key regulatory areas including Consumer Duty, SMCR, and Product Governance.
- Supporting the integration of analytics and insight into our monitoring methodology.
- Providing clear, actionable insights to senior leaders and risk owners.

What you’ll bring:
- Deep experience in second line compliance monitoring or internal audit.
- Strong knowledge of FCA conduct and regulatory expectations.
- Proven ability to lead complex reviews and manage assurance teams.
- Experience working within a non‑financial risk framework.

What else you need to know:
This role is based in Glasgow or Milton Keynes. Santander will pay the employer mandatory government fees that are required to pay in connection with visa sponsorship. You may be liable for your own personal employee immigration and relocation costs.

jobs.title: Assistant General Manager
jobs.description:
Assistant General Manager (Guest Experience Lead)

Where tree-to-cup hospitality meets world-class coffee. At Qima Café, we bring one of the world’s most extraordinary coffee journeys directly to London.

What you’ll do:
- Lead the FOH team on the floor, ensuring warm, attentive, and efficient service.

- Conduct daily service briefings and keep the team aligned on priorities.
- Train and mentor staff in upselling and guest etiquette.

- Act as first responder to guest complaints.

What we’re looking for:
- Proven leadership experience in hospitality (specialty coffee or premium dining).
- A natural host with strong communication skills.
- Ability to coach and motivate a team in a fast-paced environment.
- Ambition to grow into higher operational leadership roles.

What we offer:
- Competitive pay (£35k-£40k OTE).
- Clear progression opportunities across the Origins 1450 ecosystem.
- Staff discounts and company events.
- UK Visa Sponsorship.

Location: Warren Street, London
Hours: Full-time 45 hour contract

jobs.title: Rev-celerator Graduate Programme 2026 iOS Software Engineer
jobs.description:
Rev-celerator Graduate Programme 2026 iOS Software Engineer

About the Rev-celerator Graduate Programme:
The Rev-celerator Graduate Programme is built for ambitious graduates who want to launch their careers in fintech. Over this 12-month programme, you’ll work on real projects, solve complex challenges, and make an impact from day one.

What you'll be doing:
- Collaborating with Product Designers on new feature design and prototyping.
- Building user experiences from wireframes and mockups through to release.
- Partnering with teams across departments to deliver elegant solutions.
- Helping define and maintain visual guidelines for consistency across the app.
- Prototyping new interactions and iterating based on feedback.
- Developing expertise with the iOS SDK.

What you'll need:
- A predicted or achieved 2:1 (or equivalent grade) in Computer Science, Maths, Physics, or similar.
- To have graduated in 2024, 2025, or 2026.
- A portfolio of coding projects or open-source contributions.
- Experience with Swift and iOS SDK.
- Full-time availability from September 2026.

Visa & Relocation Support:
Revolut will support international applicants with visa assistance, travel costs, and your first month of accommodation (conditions apply).

jobs.title: Sous Chef
jobs.description:
Sous Chef - The Black Swan

The Inn Collection Group is a multi-award-winning pubs with rooms company, proudly located in some of the most outstanding destinations across the North of England and Wales.

How we say thank you!
- Celebrate your birthday with an extra paid holiday.
- Build your future with support from our Lead-Inn development program.
- Take the time you need to rest and recharge; Paid Breaks are on us.
- Enjoy 50% off food at any of our Inns.
- Relax with a stay at any of our Inns during Jan, Feb, and March for just £1.
- 1/3 off room bookings all year round.
- Tronc (tips) and Employee Assistance Programme.

You’ll fit right inn:
As Sous Chef, you’ll be at the heart of our kitchen, ensuring every dish showcases the best of fresh, quality ingredients. Working closely with the Head Chef, you’ll help maintain consistent excellence and bring creativity to the role.

Beyond cooking, your role will include stock control, ordering, and overseeing kitchen cleanliness. You’ll take charge in the Head Chef’s absence, confidently managing the team and ensuring smooth operations.

Visa & Accommodation:
This role comes with the added benefit of colleague accommodation. We welcome applications from Skilled Worker visa holders and can transfer Certificates of Sponsorship.

jobs.title: Laser Technician
jobs.description:
Laser Technician - SHAPINS Clinic

At SHAPINS Clinic, we specialise in advanced skin and body treatments that help clients look and feel their best. Our mission is to provide safe, effective, and personalised treatments delivered with compassion, integrity, and excellence.

Key Responsibilities:
- Carry out advanced skin treatments including: HydroFacial, Microneedling RF, Chemical Peels, Skin Tightening (HIFU, Radio Frequency), and Laser Hair Removal.
- Conduct in-depth client consultations and skin analysis.
- Develop bespoke treatment plans tailored to individual client needs.
- Educate clients on skincare and recommend homecare products.
- Maintain accurate client records and treatment notes.
- Ensure high standards of hygiene, safety, and professionalism.

Requirements:
- NVQ Level 3/4 (or equivalent) in Beauty Therapy / Aesthetics.
- Experience delivering advanced skin treatments (minimum 1–2 years preferred).
- Strong knowledge of skin health, conditions, and treatment options.
- Excellent communication and client care skills.

Benefits:
- Company pension and employee discount.
- Flexitime and referral programme.
- UK visa sponsorship available for the right candidate.

Location: Kensington, London (In person)

jobs.title: Sous Chef
jobs.description:

jobs.title: Senior Data Engineer (AWS)
jobs.description:

What You'll Do:
- Architect and Implement end-to-end data solutions on AWS (S3, Glue, EMR, Kinesis, Redshift).
- Lead the design of the data lake and data warehouse.

What You'll Bring:

jobs.title: Workday Systems Support Finance
jobs.description:
Workday Systems Support Finance (Continuing)

The University of Melbourne takes pride in our people, who all contribute to our mission to benefit society through the transformative impact of education and research.

Your Role:
As part of the Finance Systems Support team, you will play a crucial role in administering, maintaining, and developing the Workday Finance system. You'll collaborate with stakeholders to configure modules, troubleshoot issues, and support data management.

Your Responsibilities:
- Develop Stakeholder Relationships: Act as a trusted advisor and prioritise customer issues.
- Support Functional Configuration: Configure Workday Finance modules and contribute to enhancements.
- Manage Incidents & Problems: Troubleshoot issues and perform root-cause analysis.
- Ensure Data Quality: Create and manage EIBs and validate financial transactions.

What We Offer:
- Salary: $111,275 - $120,453 p.a. + 17% super.
- Flexible work arrangements and comprehensive leave provisions.
- Salary packaging and discounted health insurance.
- Professional development opportunities.

Visa & Eligibility:
This role is open to overseas applicants; sponsorship (482/186/485) is an option for the right skills and experience. A Working with Children Check (WWCC) is required.

jobs.title: Baker
jobs.description:
Baker - Lake House Regional Destination

Lake House is Australia's most highly awarded regional destination restaurant and hotel, situated in Daylesford. We offer the benefits of working with a professional and passionate team in an iconic hospitality destination.

What You'll Do:
- Preparing and baking sourdough bread loaves, baguettes, and rolls.
- Preparing viennoiserie and pastries inclusive of glazing.
- Kneading, maturing, cutting, moulding, mixing and shaping dough.
- Monitoring oven temperatures and product appearance to determine baking times.
- Operating machines which roll and mould dough.
- Ensuring compliance with occupational health and safety regulations.

What We're Looking For:
- Minimum 2 years of experience in a relevant role.
- Highest standards of delivery in a hatted or Michelin star environment.
- Strong attention to detail and exceptional organizational skills.
- Excellent team player with strong people and time management skills.

Visa & Sponsorship:
Nomination for temporary work visa (482) and/or Permanent Residency (186) will be considered for eligible candidates.

Hours: Full-time (40 hours per week).

jobs.title: Occupational Therapist (New Grad to Senior)
jobs.description:
Occupational Therapist Opportunities (New Grad to Senior)

Due to strong demand we are growing our services and team. Be part of our growth journey at Living Strength Care, serving Central Coast & Gosford.

Who We Are:
Since 2007, Living Strength Care has grown into a highly respected allied health provider. We focus on quality, not quotas, and have built a team culture that empowers professionals to do their best work in a genuinely supportive environment.

What You'll Do:
- Conduct functional assessments, ADL evaluations, and sensory profiles.
- Design and implement therapy programs that foster independence.
- Recommend assistive technology and environmental modifications.
- Collaborate with families, support coordinators, and multidisciplinary teams.
- (Senior Roles) Provide mentoring and help develop junior team members.

What We Offer:
- Flexible Work: Full-Time or Part-Time opportunities with hybrid options.
- Attractive Package: Competitive salary, car allowance, super, and CPD support.
- Professional Development: $1,000 CPD budget and two paid study days.
- Relocation & Sponsorship: Support available for eligible international applicants.

About You:
- Degree in Occupational Therapy + current AHPRA registration.
- Driver's Licence + reliable vehicle.
- NDIS Worker Screening Check.
- Commitment to evidence-based, person-centred care.

jobs.title: General Practitioner (GP) - DPA Location
jobs.description:
General Practitioner (GP) - Canberra DPA Location

The ACT offers an abundance of nature with over half of the area preserved as parks and reserves. Located halfway between Melbourne and Sydney, Canberra provides a perfect lifestyle balance.

The Practice:
Our newly renovated facility features 5 consulting rooms, a treatment room, and a dedicated room for cosmetic and skin procedures.

Benefits:
- $10,000 relocation allowance available.
- $175 guaranteed hourly rate for 13 weeks or 70% (whichever is higher).
- Mixed billing practice in a rare DPA location.
- Flexible hours and days.
- Full visa sponsorship and registration support.

Eligibility Requirements:
To be eligible, overseas trained doctors must hold postgraduate qualifications such as MRCGP (UK), MICGP (Ireland), FRACGP (AUS), FRNZCG (NZ), or CCFP (Canada). GPs from Hong Kong, Malaysia, Singapore, and various European countries with specialist qualifications are also encouraged to apply.

HealthStaff Recruitment Support:
We manage the entire process of your registration and visa applications. Our service is free for all candidates, providing the widest choice of medical vacancies throughout Australia.

jobs.title: General Practitioner (GP) - Raymond Terrace
jobs.description:
General Practitioner (GP) - 30 mins from Newcastle

Looking for a perfect balance between work and lifestyle? It's time to think about Australia. We are seeking a GP for a clinic in Raymond Terrace, an area famous for its beautiful river, rural views, and historic wine production.

The Practice:
A large, modern medical centre with an established patient base, ensuring you will be busy from day one. This is a rare DPA location suitable for overseas trained GPs.

Benefits:
- 70% of billings – potential income $350,000+
- Minimum guarantee of $200 p/h for the first 3 months.
- Mixed billing clinic.
- Relocation allowance of $10,000.
- Flexible hours to ensure a healthy work/life balance.
- Full visa sponsorship and guided registration process.

Eligibility Requirements:
Overseas trained doctors must hold postgraduate qualifications in General Practice (e.g., MRCGP, MICGP, CCFP). Specialist GPs from various international hubs (UK, NZ, Ireland, etc.) may be eligible for the Expedited Specialist Registration Pathway.

About the Area:
Raymond Terrace is a friendly, multicultural community just 30 minutes from the vibrant city of Newcastle. It offers proximity to Maitland and Nelson Bay, providing easy access to some of the most beautiful beaches and national parks in the world.

jobs.title: Lead Veterinarian
jobs.description:
Lead Veterinarian - Full Time

We are seeking a Full-Time Lead Veterinarian to join our team at Burpengary Vet. This role offers a flexible roster with a mix of consulting and surgical caseload to suit your interests and strengths.

About Us:
Burpengary Vet is a brand-new, purpose-built clinic with a supportive and friendly team environment. You’ll work alongside 5–6 veterinarians and 8 dedicated support staff, including an experienced nursing team.

What You’ll Be Doing:
- Managing a varied caseload across medicine and surgery.
- Mentoring, training, and supporting the GP veterinary team.
- Shaping and upholding best-practice standards.
- Driving clinical vision while aligning with business objectives.
- Utilizing advanced diagnostics (digital radiography, ultrasound, in-house lab).
- Delivering preventative healthcare and wellness checks.

Benefits:
- Competitive salary reflective of experience.
- Free access to the VetPartners CPD Training Centre.
- Generous CPD allowance and study leave.
- Flexible rosters for work-life balance.
- Relocation support available for interstate or international candidates.

About You:
- Qualified Veterinarian with AHPRA registration (or eligibility).
- Ideally 4+ years’ experience in small animal practice.
- Strong communicator and team player.

jobs.title: Sushi Chef
jobs.description:
Sushi Chef Wanted - Go-Jip K Grill & Sushi Buffet

Position Details:

Required Skills & Experience:
- Proven experience as a Sushi Chef.

What We Offer:
- Visa sponsorship (482/Occupational) available for suitable candidates.
- Competitive pay rate ($28 – $35 per hour for part-time).
- Staff meals provided.
- Friendly and supportive team environment.
- Stable hours in a growing establishment.

jobs.title: Sushi Chef
jobs.description:
Sushi Chef Wanted - Full-Time & Part-Time

We are looking for someone with:

jobs.title: Occupational Therapist - Sponsorship in Australia
jobs.description:

jobs.title: Consultant Psychiatrist (Inpatient & Community)
jobs.description:
Consultant Psychiatrist – Inpatient & Community Services

Regional Victoria | Earn up to $445,000 + Super | Visa & Relocation Support Available

We are seeking Consultant Psychiatrists to join a growing Mental Health Service across inpatient and community settings in regional Victoria. These roles offer genuine flexibility, strong multidisciplinary support, and the opportunity to shape services during a period of major expansion.

Opportunity Highlights:

Eligibility & Requirements:

What’s on Offer:

- Relocation assistance for eligible international candidates.
- Full visa sponsorship (482/186) available.
- Outstanding lifestyle with easy access to beaches and national parks.

jobs.title: Manicurist (Nail Technician)
jobs.description:
Manicurist & Nail Technician - Trainees Welcome

We are seeking a dedicated and enthusiastic manicurist to join our team in Southport! No prior experience is necessary, as we offer comprehensive training to help you succeed in the beauty industry.

Key Responsibilities:

What We Offer:

Additional Perks:

jobs.title: General Practitioner (VR or Non-VR GP)
jobs.description:
General Practitioner (VR or Non-VR GP) – Stunning Victorian Alps

Be part of a large supportive team offering flexible hours and provide exceptional care to a vibrant community in the stunning Victorian Alps! This is a rare DPA position offering visa sponsorship and rural incentive payments.

The Practice:
A newly renovated facility in a beautiful, modernized early 19th-century building. The facility includes 13 consulting rooms, a fully equipped kitchen, and free parking. You’ll join a highly skilled team of 10 GPs, including specialists in Anaesthetics and Obstetrics.

What’s on Offer:

- Level 2 and 3 supervision provided.
- Partnership opportunities available.

- Prioritized work-life balance (Mon-Fri, 8:30am - 6pm).

The Location:
Mansfield offers breathtaking natural beauty with lush forests and pristine rivers, just 30 minutes from the renowned Mount Buller Ski Resort. It combines a lively arts and culture scene with a relaxed and fulfilling regional lifestyle.

Eligibility:
- GPs holding Specialist or General Registration with AHPRA.
- Fellowship program participants (RACGP or ACRRM).
- International candidates eligible for the PEP-Specialist Pathway.

jobs.title: Head of Department – Electrical & Electronic Engineering
jobs.description:
Head of Department – Electrical & Electronic Engineering

The University of Melbourne is seeking a visionary leader to head the Department of Electrical & Electronic Engineering. This role offers a unique chance to shape the long-term vision of the department and contribute to its global impact.

Your Role:
As the Head of Department, you will lead and inspire a team of academic professionals, aligning departmental goals with strategic plans to achieve excellence in teaching and research. You will play a pivotal role in fostering a positive and inclusive culture while building strategic partnerships with industry and academic stakeholders.

Your Responsibilities:
- Lead and Manage: Provide strategic leadership and manage resources for the department.
- Drive Performance: Develop performance targets and enhance teaching/research programs.
- Build Partnerships: Engage with industry, government, and academic partners globally.
- Foster Culture: Promote diversity, inclusion, and safety while mentoring staff.

What We Offer:
- Salary: $236,824 p.a. + 17% super (significant retirement benefit).
- Flexible work arrangements and comprehensive leave provisions.
- Salary packaging and discounted health services.
- A vibrant academic community in one of the world's most livable cities.

Visa & Eligibility:
Visa sponsorship is available for this position (482/186). A Working with Children Check (WWCC) is required for all positions.

jobs.title: Restoration Technician (Carpet & Flood)
jobs.description:
Restoration and Carpet Cleaning Technician

Elite Maintenance Services is looking for a motivated Restoration and Carpet Cleaning Technician to join our team in Hobart. This role offers variety, combining restoration services with carpet and upholstery cleaning.

Your Responsibilities:
- Manage water/fire damage restoration and mould remediation.
- Perform carpet, upholstery, pest control, and flood restoration services.
- Conduct onsite risk assessments and hazard identification.
- Provide detailed assessment reports and maintain equipment.
- Deliver exceptional customer service and recommend additional services.

About You:
- Experience in restoration and/or cleaning (carpet cleaning is a plus).
- Valid driver’s license and legal working rights in Australia.
- Physically fit and able to handle equipment.
- Attention to detail with strong communication skills.
- IICRC certification or pest control license is an advantage.

What We Offer:
- Competitive, negotiable salary.
- Ongoing training and career development (IICRC, pest control, etc.).
- A supportive team environment with a respected Australian brand.
- Visa sponsorship (482/494) available for suitable candidates.

jobs.title: Pharmacist
jobs.description:
Pharmacist - Robina Shopping Centre Clinic

Join a growing, patient‑centred clinic as our new Pharmacist and enjoy a rewarding blend of clinical practice and leadership. Our mission is to simplify access to plant-based medicine and integrate it with mainstream healthcare.

Your Role:
Deliver high‑impact medication reviews, work closely with GPs to shape care pathways, and mentor a small talented team in a modern, well‑resourced setting.

What You'll Be Doing:
- Dispense prescriptions accurately and efficiently.
- Provide professional medication advice and counselling to patients.
- Review medication regimens to identify interactions or adverse effects.
- Maintain accurate patient records and ensure regulatory compliance.
- Work collaboratively with healthcare teams for coordinated care.
- Train and mentor pharmacy technicians and interns.

About You:
- Current AHPRA Registration.
- Keen interest to learn more about alternative and plant-based medicine.
- Exceptional eye for detail and accuracy.
- Ability to work and make decisions under pressure.

What We Offer:
- Competitive salary and generous professional development support.
- Flexible rostering to protect work–life balance.
- Relocation assistance and Visa sponsorship (482/186) for eligible candidates.
- Real scope to grow your clinical career in a modern environment.
